1210LA010-d-12-16-10-UP.Narrative: THE MWCRV-16 DEPARTED CLIFF SIDING AT 10 MPH ON A 2.2 DESCENDING GRADE DROPPED TO 6 MPH AFTER CLEARING SIDING.  ENGINEER DECIDED TO TRANSITION DPU FROM DYNAMIC BRAKE TO POWER TO SHOVE TRAIN.  ONCE TRAIN REGAINED SPEED, ENGINEER DROPPED THE FENCE TO THE DPU ALLOWING THE COMPUTER TO TAKE OVER AND CATCH UP WITH THE LEAD UNIT IN THROTTLE 8 DYNAMIC BRAKE.  THE DPU ONCE IN THROTTLE 8 DYNAMICS PULLED THETRAIN TOO HARD RESULTING IN A STRING-LINE EFFECT CAUSING 7 EMPTY CARS TO DERAIL ON A 10 DEGREE CURVE.  RAIL= CWR

1210RS010-d-12-12-10-UP.Narrative: THE KG2LT-10 PULLED INTO THE EAST END OF THE LATHROP INTERMODAL FACILITY & RAN OVER A FIXED DERAIL DERAILING 3 LOCOMOTIVES.  CREW HAD LANDING INSTRUCTIONS FROM THE GATE HOUSE TO PULL INTO TRACK 703 &CUT THE CROSSINGS.  ENGINEER STOPPED TRAIN SHORT OF THE SIDING SWITCH, CONDUCTOR GOT OFF THE TRAIN,LINED THE SIDING SWITCH & DERAIL LOCATED ON THE LEAD.  THEN WALKED TOWARD THE 703 SWITCH, SAW THAT IT WAS LINED FOR THEIR MOVE, TOLD THE ENGINEER THE SWITCH WAS LINED FOR THEIR MOVE.  THE ENGINEER PROCEEDED TO PULL THE TRAIN INTO TRACK 703 & DID NOT SEE THE DERAIL TARGET THAT WAS COLORED ALL WHITE.THE LETTER "D" BLENDED IN WITH THE WHITE BACKGROUND & WAS NOT EASILY VISIBLE.  HE DID NOT STOP THETRAIN SHORT OF THE DERAIL ON TRACK 703, WHICH WAS IN THE DERAILING POSITION, DERAILING 3 LOCOMOTIVES.  INDUSTRIAL RAILWAYS COMPANY REPLACED THE DERAIL TARGET THE FOLLOWING DAY.

AS THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE STARTED TO STRIKE THE CATTLE IT WAS OBSERVED THAT THERE WERE A NUMBER OF COWS.  AS THE TRAINWENT OVER DRAGGING EQUIPMENT DETECTOR AT MP79.6 THE DETECTOR INDICATED DEBRIS ON AND AROUND TRAIN.A TOTAL OF 186 CATTLE WERE STRUCK AND KILLED BY THE TRAIN WITH ANOTHER 32 SUBSEQUENTLY DESTROYED DUE TO INJURY.  UPON INVESTIGATION IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE SNOW HAD DRIFTED OVER THE TOP OF THE FENCE LINES.  THE CATTLE HAD WALKED OVER AND LAYED DOWN NEAR THE UPRR SWITCH HEATER AT EAST COKEVILLE,WY FOR WARMTH.  RAIL = CWR

693551-d-12-25-10-CC.Primary Accident Cause: Other extreme environmental conditions (Provide detailed description in narrative)
693551-d-12-25-10-CC.Accident Cause: Other extreme environmental conditions (Provide detailed description in narrative)
693551-d-12-25-10-CC.Narrative: L58691-25 OPERATING CONVENTIONAL AT A 1.69 HPT ON THE BNSF AURORA SUB DERAILED 14 CARS AND 2 LOCOMOTIVES COMING OUT OF RENTEC ENERGY. THIRTEEN OF THE DERAILED CARS CONTAINED CARBON DIOXIDE, REFRIGERATED LIQUID, OF WHICH ONE CAR WAS LEAKING. THERE WAS  A PRODUCT LOSS OF 14,631 GALLONS FROM CAR TILX 400432. THIS IS A VERY REMOTE AREA AND NO EVACUATIONS WERE NEEDED. THE CREW PERFORMED A CLASS 1 BRAKETEST AS PER TIMETABLE #2 SPECIAL CONDITIONS RENTEC LEAD. THE CONDUCTOR ALSO APPLIED 12 RETAINING VALVES INTO (HP) POSITION, THE TIMETABLE STATES A MINIMUM OF 5 RETAINING VALVES MUST BE APPLIED. THE ENGINEER STARTED DOWN THE 3 PERCENT DOWNHILL GRADE AND TOOK A MINIMUM BRAKE PIPE REDUCTION WITH NO EFFECT. HE THEN MADE TWO MORE REDUCTIONS WITH STILL NO EFFECT AND APPLIED THE EMERGENCY BRAKE PIPE. THE CONDUCTOR SET THE HANDBRAKE TO ENGINE GTW 4929 AND BOTH CREW MEMBERS JUMPED OFF THE LOCOMOTIVE. NOINJURIES WERE REPORTED. IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE DERAILMENT WAS DUE TO A BUILDUP OF SNOW AND ICEON THE WHEELS AND BRAKE SHOES. DERAILED WERE UNITS CN 4715 & GTW 4929 AND CARS: CC 482025, TILX 400432, TILX 400431, GATX 38066, GATX 27413, CDCX 3118, UTLX 900107, TILX 201062, TILX 201029, CDCX 3116, GATX 2944, TILX201021, GATX 380088, TILX 201023.  BNSF REPORTED $130,103 IN TRACK AND SIGNAL DAMAGE.  ALL 14 CARS WERE SCRAPPED.  RAILROAD VERIFIED THE FRA TRACK CLASS & CONSIST SPEED.

12272010-d-12-27-10-SNJX.Narrative: AT THE DULTY'S LANE GRADE CROSSING IN FLORENCE, NJ. TRAIN #285 WAS A SINGLE UNIT CONSIST, PROCEEDINGSOUTHBOUND (RAILROAD DIRECTION), WITH TWELVE (12) PASSENGERS ON BOARD. THERE WERE NO (0) INJURIES REPORTED BY THE LRV OPERATOR. TWO (2) PASSENGERS ON BOARD THE LRV CLAIMED NON-SPECIFIC NECK AND INJURIES AND WERE TRANSPORTED VIA AMBULANCE FROM THE SCENE TO A LOCAL HOSPITAL. THE DRIVER OF THE TRACTOR-TRAILER DID NOT REPORT ANY INJURIES. TO DATE, NO SERIOUS INJURIES HAVE BEEN REPORTED AND ALL PARTIES TAKEN TO HOSPITALS WERE RELEASED. THE LRV SUSTAINED DAMAGE TO THE DIME, THE ELECTRICAL COUPLER HEAD AND ANTICLIMBER COVER AS WELL AS MINOR DAMAGE TO THE FIBERGLASS CAR BODY END CAP. ALL SYSTEMS FUNCTIONED ACCORDING TO DESIGN WITH THE ACTIVATION OF THE GRADE CROSSING WARNING SYSTEMS INCLUDING GATE,BELLS AND FLASHERS. THE LRV BRAKING SYSTEM FUNCTIONED ACCORDING TO DESIGN.

1210LV011-d-12-15-10-UP.Narrative: YAV07-15 SIDESWIPED THEIR OWN TRAIN WHILE DOUBLING UP THE MCXEW-14.  THE FOREMAN MADE THE CUT FOULING THE DRILL TRACK THROUGH THE X-OVER.  SHE INTENDED TO MAKE THE CUT 2 CARS EAST OF WHERE SHE ACTUALLY MADE THE CUT.  THE HEAD END WENT INTO EMERGENCY, AND SHE CLOSED THE ANGLE COCK ON THE HEAD END.  SHE THEN OPENED THE ANGLE COCK THAT SHE CLOSED AT THE INTENDED CUT.  SHE LINED THE X-OVER AND WALKEDTO THE SOLAR SWITCH LINING AS SHE WALKED APPROXIMATELY 15 CARS AWAY.  SHE THEN INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO SHOVE TO HER.  SHE WAS ONLY ABLE TO SEE THE NORTH SIDE OF THE CARS FROM HER ANGLE.  THE SOUTHSIDE WAS THE DAMAGED SIDE.  SHE DIDN'T SEE OR HEAR ANYTHING.  THE ENGINEER STOPPED THE MOVE AFTER HEHEARD SCRAPING AND SAW THE DAMAGED CAR ON THE MAIN LINE.  9 CARS WERE DAMAGED.  NOTHING DERAILED.
